FAIL_TO_PASS: when implicit help option then help option not affected
when negatable boolean flag not specified then value is true
when program has unknown option before operands then all unknown in same order
when program has combo known boolean short flags then arg removed
when program has value/no flag specified with value then specified value
when specify unknown option with simple program then error
when specify unknown option with subcommand and action handler then error
when program has combo optional and combineFlagAndOptionalValue(true) then treat as value
when variadic with long combined argument then not variadic
when global option then candidate for subcommand option suggestion
when program has unknown option then option returned in unknown
when program has subcommands and specify only unknown option then display help
when source from env and implied undefined then implied is implied
when program has mixed arguments then known options removed and rest returned in same order
when add two options then help contains group with two options
when source default and implied undefined then implied is undefined
when cli of --cat and options ["--at"] then suggest --at because 1 deletion
when cli of --bat and options ["--cat"] then suggest --cat because 1 substitution
when add option then visible (with help)
when program has flag after subcommand then option removed
